newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spanish farmers dump French wheat in reprisal.
newsitem.headline: Spanish farmers dump French wheat in reprisal.

text.p: Farmers in northern Spain dumped and burned a truckload of wheat from France on Thursday in the first reprisal for a week of similar attacks on Spanish truckers importing fruit and vegetables into France, state radio said.
The French truck was stopped late on Thursday by farmers in Spain's Navarre province, who destroyed 25 tonnes of wheat.
Earlier on Thursday, French farmers attacked a warehouse near Bayonne which distributes Spanish produce and destroyed potatoes, tomatoes, cherries and beans, Spanish television reported.
French officials said police and justice authorities had been ordered to crack down on such attacks after Spain complained they were passive in the face of repeated aggression.
Despite a French apology, Madrid has also complained to the European Union, asking for measures to be taken against Paris.
Over the past week, French farmers who want tighter controls on imported produce have stopped incoming Spanish trucks to dump and burn their fresh fruits and vegetables.
A Spanish truck driver had to be treated in a French hospital in Montpellier earlier this week after being attacked.
